reviewText: Good to have in your DVD library.
This is a wonderful story about  the Negro League.  It doesn't just highlight Jackie Robinson's accomplishment.  You learn about the accomplishments of other great in the league.
very good history lesson for those who have forgotten or don't know anything about the negro leagues,I have passed this dvd on to others and have received request to order more.
great look back at the history of some of the nation's great heros. a must see for people of all backgrounds and ages.
I love adding this movie to my collection. I love everything that tells our history.
I saw this on MLB channel and had to have it. It is very educational about the Old Negro League. I highly recommend it.

There is no emphasis on how African Americans in general were treated with such blatant disrespect. Rube Foster along with other African American baseball players were clever enough to start their own baseball league. This DVD focused only on the Negro Leagues. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS DVD TO ANYONE WHO ENJOYS BASEBALL, PERIOD.
Purchased this for my Grandson who really loves baseball and is a great player himself.  I loved the fast shipping and Great price.
Good history background, I like this CD.

If you love baseball as much as I do, this is a must have.  The cheap price is not a reflection on poor quality but rather it's only about an hour long.  It's a great documentary about the Negro Leagues and is filled with interviews from numerous former players.  It's narrated by Dave Winfield who does a great job also.  Highly recommend.
A great learning experience.  Always interested in African-American contributions to society.
